title: BC Children‚Äôs Hospital QA Chatbot: A Safety-focused AI Tool for Hospital Discharge Support
text:
Project Overview
During a two month internship with BC Children‚Äôs Hosptial‚Äôs Digital Lab, my team and I created an end-to-end Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) chatbot for medical queries. It provides trustworthy information to patients and caregivers via a dataset of curated healthcare resources.


Key Features

Data Preprocessing: Parsing, cleaning and chunking of heterogenous data sources (PDFs, websites, etc.)
Semantic Search: FAISS vector database with optional ColBERT reranking for improved relevance

LLM Integration: LLM-powered answer generation with LangChain for structured output and prompt engineering to minimize hallucination
Evaluation Toolkit: Multi-metric assessment using both retrieval metrics (precision, recall, F1) and generation quality metrics (LLM judges, semantic similarity scores)

Object Oriented Design: Modular and scalable system to facilitate integration of new data sources and models.
Frontend Application: Intuitive chatbot interface for physicians and patients
Documentation: Complete documentation for maintaining and modifying the system, ensuring smooth handoff to the hospital‚Äôs development team



Tech Stack

Languages: Python, JavaScript, HTML, CSS
ML/AI: LangChain, LLM API integration (OpenAI, Google Gen AI, Hugging Face)
Vector Database: FAISS, ColBERT reranking
Web Framework: Flask
Evaluation: Prometheus LLM judge, AlignScore, BERT Score, BLEU Score, etc.
Tools: Jupyter notebooks, Git

title: BC Children‚Äôs Hospital QA Chatbot: A Safety-focused AI Tool for Hospital Discharge Support
text:
Project Details

Problem Statement
Patients and families often struggle to find reliable, accessible medical information online. While there are many healthcare resources available, navigating them effectively requires significant time and effort. There was a need for a system that could understand medical questions and provide accurate, trustworthy answers.


Approach & Solution
Read more about our approach on Medium


Results & Impact
By the end of our internship, we had:
- Created a baseline retrieval system for future healthcare AI applications at BC Children‚Äôs Hospital
- Implemented comprehensive evaluation pipeline for both retrieval and generation quality
- Created a user-friendly chatbot interface that provides answers with source links


Key Challenges
There were several challenges we faced:
- Data Quality & Variety: Handling messy, heterogeneous data from various healthcare sources with different formats and structures
- LLM Hallucination: Implementing prompt engineering strategies to minimize hallucination, though complete elimination proved challenging
- Evaluation Framework: Designing an evaluation framework for LLM outputs without extensive manual annotation
